definitions.definition: the time between when it becomes light in the morning and when it becomes dark in the evening
definitions.sensetop: during the dayby dayon a… day

a fine summer's day

examples.text: a seven-hour **working day**

definitions.definition: a particular period of time or history
definitions.sensetop: in somebody's dayin the days of somethingin those days

examples.text: in Queen Victoria’s day
in the days of the Industrial Revolution
back in the **early days** of computers

in the **old days** *(= in the past)*

the dark days of recession
the heady days of the ‘swinging sixties’

the government of the day

definitions.definition: a particular period in somebody's life or career

examples.text: I have many happy memories from my student days.
in his younger days

Much has changed since the days of my youth.

definitions.definition: part of your normal working life and not unusual

examples.text: Swimming with sharks or training a tiger cub—it's all in a day's work for animal wrangler Chris Bolton.

definitions.definition: very soon

examples.text: The letter should arrive any day now.

definitions.definition: used to introduce the most important fact after everything has been considered

examples.text: At the end of the day, he'll still have to make his own decision.

definitions.definition: in the past

examples.text: My dad's always talking about how great everything was back in the day.

definitions.definition: at a particular time in the past

examples.text: I was a fan back in the days when the band wasn't yet famous.

definitions.definition: the moment in the early hours of the morning when it begins to get light
to decide or agree to stop doing something

examples.text: After forty years in politics I think it's time for me to call it a day *(= to retire)*.

definitions.definition: to be successful against somebody/something

examples.text: Despite strong opposition, the ruling party carried the day.
Teamwork and persistence can still win the day.

definitions.definition: easy to see or understand
each day repeatedly (used especially when something is boring or annoying)

examples.text: She hates doing the same work day after day.

definitions.definition: all the time; continuously

examples.text: The store is open day and night.
The machines are kept running night and day.

definitions.definition: all the time; a little at a time and gradually

examples.text: Day by day his condition improved.
Morale was sinking day by day.

definitions.definition: every day for a long period of time

examples.text: Living on junk food day in day out is not good for you.

definitions.definition: the time when somebody will have to deal with the result of something that they have done wrong, or be punished for something bad that they have done
a person or thing will not continue to live, exist or be successful for much longer

examples.text: His days as leader of the party are numbered.
Whatever the protests, the school’s days are numbered and it will be closed down.

definitions.definition: to spend the last part of your life in a particular state or place

examples.text: He ended his days in poverty.

definitions.definition: everyone has good luck or success at some point in their life
the time when you have to do something difficult or unpleasant

examples.text: I’d better go and see the dentist—I can’t put off the evil hour any longer.

definitions.definition: the amount of fruit or vegetables that some organizations say you should eat in order to be healthy

examples.text: Start your five a day with a banana for breakfast.

definitions.definition: from the beginning

examples.text: It's never worked from day one.
This game makes reading and spelling fun from day one.

definitions.definition: with no thoughts or plans for the future

examples.text: They live from day to day, looking after their sick daughter.

definitions.definition: if a situation changes from day to day, it changes often

examples.text: A baby's need for food can vary from day to day.

definitions.definition: if a situation changes from one day to the next, it is uncertain and not likely to stay the same each day

examples.text: I never know what to expect from one day to the next.

definitions.definition: beginning on that day; from that time

examples.text: From that day forth she gave me endless friendship and encouragement.

definitions.definition: used to say that you prefer a particular thing or person to the one that has just been mentioned

examples.text: We don't go out much. Give me a quiet night in front of the TV any day!

definitions.definition: a helpful, kind thing that you do

examples.text: I took Sarah’s children to school so I’ve done my good deed for the day.
She felt that she had done her good deed for the day.

definitions.definition: an earlier period of time in your life or in history that is seen as better/worse than the present

examples.text: That was in the bad old days of rampant inflation.

definitions.definition: to no longer be successful, powerful, etc.

examples.text: She's had her day as a supermodel.

definitions.definition: a friendly way of saying goodbye, especially to customers
to be in poor condition

examples.text: Our car has seen better days!

definitions.definition: (used when talking about somebody’s age) at least

examples.text: He must be 70 if he's a day!

definitions.definition: used when you are very surprised at something you have never heard or seen before

examples.text: I've never heard such nonsense in all my born days.

definitions.definition: when you have had time to think calmly about something; in the morning when things are clearer

examples.text: These things always look different in the cold light of day.

definitions.definition: during the part of somebody’s life when they were most successful, famous, etc.

examples.text: She was a great dancer in her day.
Things were very different in my grandfather's day.

definitions.definition: when somebody was young

examples.text: In my day, there were plenty of jobs when you left school.
In Grandfather’s day, owning a television was very unusual.

definitions.definition: a long time ago in the past

examples.text: What was life like in the olden days, Gran?

definitions.definition: now, in the modern world

examples.text: Slavery continues to exist, even in this day and age.

definitions.definition: used to say that it is too soon to be sure how a situation will develop

examples.text: It’s early days yet. We don’t know if the play will be a success.

definitions.definition: used when several bad or unpleasant things happen on the same day

examples.text: My car broke down and then I locked myself out—it's just not my day!

definitions.definition: after the time when an action could be successful

examples.text: He started working hard much too late in the day—he couldn't possibly catch up.

definitions.definition: the whole length of the day
used to say that although you have failed or had a bad experience, you will continue
to make somebody feel very happy on a particular day

examples.text: The phone call from Mike really made my day.

definitions.definition: to make a particular activity that you enjoy last for a whole day/evening instead of only part of it

examples.text: We took a picnic lunch to the river and made a day of it.
They decided to make a night of it and went on to a club.

definitions.definition: all the time; continuously

examples.text: The machines are kept running night and day.
The store is open day and night.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that makes people excited for a short time but does not last very long
to refuse to speak to somebody because you do not like or respect them

examples.text: Since the success of her novel, people shake her hand who once wouldn't have given her the time of day.

definitions.definition: to not have much time

examples.text: Come on! We don't have all day!

definitions.definition: during a particular period of time when somebody lived

examples.text: the best player of his day
Bessie Smith was the Madonna of her day.

definitions.definition: of the present time

examples.text: the political issues of the day

definitions.definition: that is served on a particular day in a restaurant

examples.text: soup of the day

definitions.definition: used to emphasize what you are saying when you are surprised, shocked or annoyed

examples.text: Oh my days! Is that true?

definitions.definition: at some time in the future, or on a particular day in the past

examples.text: One day, I want to leave the city and move to the country.

definitions.definition: before a long time has passed

examples.text: One of these days you'll come back and ask me to forgive you.

definitions.definition: a day when there are a lot of mistakes and a lot of things go wrong

examples.text: It's been one of those days!

definitions.definition: common, popular or suitable at a particular time or for a particular occasion

examples.text: Pessimism seems to be the order of the day.

definitions.definition: recently

examples.text: I saw Jack the other day.
I was in your area the other week.
I woke up the other morning and just could not get myself out of bed.
I was watching TV the other evening, when…

definitions.definition: to say hello to somebody and have a short conversation with them
very obvious
used to say that a complicated task will take a long time and should not be rushed
the time when you are young and do not have much experience of life
to prevent failure or defeat, when this seems certain to happen

examples.text: Salah's late goal saved the day for Liverpool.

definitions.definition: to save something, especially money, for a time when you will really need it
at an unknown time in the future

examples.text: Some day I'll be famous.

definitions.definition: to not think about what will happen in the future

examples.text: I don't know if he'll get better. We're just taking it one day at a time.

definitions.definition: used when you are saying that something is very unlikely to happen

examples.text: Paul? Apologize? That'll be the day!

definitions.definition: used to suggest that a time in the past was happier or better than now
exactly

examples.text: It's been three years to the day since we met.

definitions.definition: even now, when a lot of time has passed

examples.text: To this day, I still don't understand why he did it.
